Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery slightly grooved vessel, the interior is covered with a glossy dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of one Coptic word written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394661) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394661)
